attributes.action: Inclusion of smaller parties in leadership debates
attributes.additional_details: In 2010, the leaders of britains smaller parties were excluded from General Election Debates, this was not only counter-democratic, but meant that the 12% of the electorate in 2010 had no representation in these debates at all. I believe that it is only right that UKIP, The Green Party, SNP and Plaid Cymru are present in our next General Election Leadership Debates.
